text: Edgard Salvé (born 1 August 1946) is a retired Belgian middle distance runner who specialized in the 1500 metres. He was born in Bensberg, Germany, but represented the sports club RFC Liège. His greatest achievement was winning the 1969 European Indoor Games. He finished fifth at the 1967 European Indoor Games, fourth at the 1969 European Championships. and seventh at the 1970 European Indoor Championships, and also competed at the 1968 and 1972 Olympic Games without reaching the final. His personal best time was 3:39.91 minutes (1969). In the 3000 metres he finished seventh at the 1975 European Indoor Championships. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Belgian male middle-distance runners Category:Belgian male long- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Belgium
title: Edgard Salvé
